alert.note: Alert for Coastal Onslow (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued April 09 at 9:42PM EDT until April 10 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, 1 to 2 feet of above ground inundation. For the Beach Hazards Statement, strong longshore currents in the surf zone. * WHERE...Coastal Onslow County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 2 AM EDT Monday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures possible. Strong longshore currents will create dangerous swimming conditions.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Strong longshore currents can sweep swimmers and surfers into rip currents, piers, jetties and other hazardous areas. In many cases, the longshore current is strong enough to prevent swimmers from being able to keep their feet on the bottom making it difficult to return to shore.
